io.netty.channel

类 FixedRecvByteBufAllocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.channel.DefaultMaxMessagesRecvByteBufAllocator
      • io.netty.channel.FixedRecvByteBufAllocator
  • 所有已实现的接口:
    MaxMessagesRecvByteBufAllocator, RecvByteBufAllocator

    public class FixedRecvByteBufAllocator
extends DefaultMaxMessagesRecvByteBufAllocator
    The RecvByteBufAllocator that always yields the same buffer size prediction. This predictor ignores the feed back from the I/O thread.

    • 嵌套类概要

      • 从类继承的嵌套类/接口 io.netty.channel.DefaultMaxMessagesRecvByteBufAllocator

      • 从接口继承的嵌套类/接口 io.netty.channel.RecvByteBufAllocator

    • 构造器概要

      构造器 
      构造器和说明
      FixedRecvByteBufAllocator(int bufferSize)
      Creates a new predictor that always returns the same prediction of the specified buffer size.

    • 方法详细资料

      • newHandle

        public RecvByteBufAllocator.Handle newHandle()
        从接口复制的说明: RecvByteBufAllocator
        Creates a new handle. The handle provides the actual operations and keeps the internal information which is required for predicting an optimal buffer capacity.

      • respectMaybeMoreData

        public FixedRecvByteBufAllocator respectMaybeMoreData(boolean respectMaybeMoreData)
        从类复制的说明: DefaultMaxMessagesRecvByteBufAllocator
        Determine if future instances of RecvByteBufAllocator.newHandle() will stop reading if we think there is no more data.
        覆盖:
        respectMaybeMoreData 在类中 DefaultMaxMessagesRecvByteBufAllocator
        参数:
        respectMaybeMoreData -
        • true to stop reading if we think there is no more data. This may save a system call to read from the socket, but if data has arrived in a racy fashion we may give up our DefaultMaxMessagesRecvByteBufAllocator.maxMessagesPerRead() quantum and have to wait for the selector to notify us of more data.
        • false to keep reading (up to DefaultMaxMessagesRecvByteBufAllocator.maxMessagesPerRead()) or until there is no data when we attempt to read.
        返回:
        this.
